intro: Haplophyllum hispanicum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy haplophyllum, is a perennial shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
